frontmatter.title: Resolution Mobile Service Design
frontmatter.excerpt: A mobile app to pair with Resmed's CPAP machines.

markdownRemark.html:
Collaboration with Gautham Sajith, Anurati Sodani, and Shuqi Yang.

My team researched and designed a mobile service design solution for the company ResMed (our project has no real affiliation with the company).

See the full process book below

See our pitch slides below

internal.content:
# 1. UXEcon 2020 Break

Summer 2020

During my internship at Google, I had the opportunity to make the break screen for the virtual 2-day annual conference for all UX Engineers (and friends) at Google. The style guide for all conference materials was inspired by Bauhaus textiles work. I produced a 30 minute video, counting down from 30 minutes to 0 minutes. The animation was made with Maya 2019, and rendered with Arnold Renderer. ## Video ## Clips ![uxecon clip](../images/art/uxecon_final_v2_1.gif) ![uxecon clip](../images/art/uxecon_final_v2_2.gif) # 2. Halloween

Spring 2020

Halloween is a story about friendship. This project is a collaboration with Jessica Cao, Sashank Gogula, Jisoo Geum and Christina Sellountos. Created in Animation, Art and Technology, taught by Jessica Hodgins and James Duesing. ## The final video ## Process video # 3. Other work
![dog](../images/art/dog.gif)

internal.content:
For my Human-Computer Interaction second major, I did a capstone project with Christine Chen, Jessica Lim, and Jessica Timczyk.

CTAT, which stands for Cognitive Tutor Authoring Tools, are tools used to create intelligent tutors that drive the behavior of online worksheets that simulate a human tutor by providing step-by-step hints and immediate feedback to a student. They've been in development at CMU for 20 years.

On this project, I was the lead prototyper. I also contributed to the design and UX research. I used both Figma and Vue.js to prototype the end experience. Because this was a deeply technical project, my expertise was also helpful for guiding the design process.

## Final report

<iframe src="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Csi9mAnSDx5hZ7yiEkUVm9xpE9yKDfdG/preview" width="640" height="480" allow="autoplay"></iframe>

frontmatter.title: Educational Authoring Tools
frontmatter.excerpt: Building upon authoring tools used to create intelligent tutors that drive the behavior of online worksheets that simulate a human tutor.

previous.rawMarkdownBody:
For my Human-Computer Interaction second major, I did a capstone project with Christine Chen, Jessica Lim, and Jessica Timczyk.

CTAT, which stands for Cognitive Tutor Authoring Tools, are tools used to create intelligent tutors that drive the behavior of online worksheets that simulate a human tutor by providing step-by-step hints and immediate feedback to a student. They've been in development at CMU for 20 years.

On this project, I was the lead prototyper. I also contributed to the design and UX research. I used both Figma and Vue.js to prototype the end experience. Because this was a deeply technical project, my expertise was also helpful for guiding the design process.

## Final report

<iframe src="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Csi9mAnSDx5hZ7yiEkUVm9xpE9yKDfdG/preview" width="640" height="480" allow="autoplay"></iframe>
